title: AdaGReS:Adaptive Greedy Context Selection via Redundancy-Aware Scoring for Token-Budgeted RAG
summary: AdaGReS is a novel framework for token-budgeted Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) that addresses the issue of redundant context by optimizing a set-level objective combining query-chunk relevance and intra-set redundancy penalties. It employs greedy selection with an adaptively calibrated trade-off parameter, theoretically guaranteeing near-optimality for context selection. Experimental results, particularly on a high-redundancy biomedical corpus, demonstrate consistent improvements in redundancy control, context quality, and end-to-end answer generation.

title: Computational Analysis of Disease Progression in Pediatric Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
summary: This study developed and calibrated patient-specific, multi-scale computational cardiovascular models for four pediatric Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) patients using longitudinal MRI and catheterization data. By coupling 3D fluid-structure interaction models of pulmonary arteries with 0D heart/Windkessel models, the researchers successfully non-invasively captured patient-specific hemodynamic adaptation over time, with model-derived metrics aligning with clinical indicators of disease severity and progression. This approach offers a promising tool for monitoring pediatric PAH and informing future treatment strategies.

title: MAMA-Memeia! Multi-Aspect Multi-Agent Collaboration for Depressive Symptoms Identification in Memes
summary: This paper introduces MAMAMemeia, a novel multi-agent multi-aspect discussion framework grounded in Cognitive Analytic Therapy (CAT) Competencies, for identifying depressive symptoms in memes shared on social media. It also presents RESTOREx, a vital resource of Large Language Model (LLM) generated and human-annotated explanations, demonstrating a substantial 7.55% improvement in macro-F1 over state-of-the-art methods and establishing a new benchmark.
